title: How to write 'because' in Japanese - Quora

response.answer_text: The most basic way is using から (kara). It works like the word “so” tho, so it comes in the middle of the two sentences you want to connect. たとえば。。。 今日まだ食べませんでした*から*、お腹がすきました。 kyou mada tabemasendeshita *kara*, onaka ga sukimashita. Today I didn't eat yet, so my belly emptied (wich is the japanese way yo say you're hungry) Another way to say because in japanese is ので, which works the exatc same way as から and means the same thing, but is more formal and objective.

You can use から (kara) to express “because” in japanese. This instagram post below have more explanation on how to use and sample sentence CrunchyNihongo’s Instagram profile post: “Today we’re going to learn about kara as a cause/reason marker on a sentence. Note that this is not the only usage of kara. For example…”
